page.title: 18CUNSWICK HALL FARM
page.content: Previously run by the Monks,{Cunswick {Hall}was inhabited by the{Leyburnes between 1216-1737, and they represented Westmorland in Parliament and also fought for the king. Cunswick is supposedly{haunted}by the ghost of {Roger de Leyburne,}who stabbed his father in order to inherit the hall. After the body was found, Roger was forced to confess, and he himself was later found stabbed.{Henry VIII}is said to have stayed at the hall while courting{Katherine Parr.}Very little remains of the orginal Hall, now a farmhouse. The old window containing {the first glass in Westmorland remains, as do the yew trees planted during Tudor times. The{pele tower}was destroyed after James Leyburne gave the bell and clock to Kendal(1582), but the royal arms engraved in stone still remain over the archway.
